  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was already inside a black when I arrived in QA. DescribePack: Two bottles had a loose cap and leaked out its liquid. The box got wet, crushed, and is now missing a side. The other two bottles are still in good shipping condition. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was double bagged and placed in a black tub in QA.

item.title: Report X-2024040906
item.description:
Report X-2024040906

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found by manager on FTWO trailer #833800. was placed in Hazmat spill bin and brought to QA work station table. There was no need for clean up box was very wet. time package was discovered was 5 AM. DescribePack: bottom of package was wet and ruptured due to two gallon containers having vertical cracks. cracks were about 2" in length. the other two gallon containers were undamaged other than outer labeling which were damaged due to leaking contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: manager placed item inside hazmat spill bin

DescribePack: cracked around the base of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: kept still in tote. pressure from its weight keeps the contents inside the drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040872
item.description:

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being off loaded from the trailer; small release could be detected inside the package. parcel was removed from the sort and placed in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: no package failures. crack around the base of the plastic drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package kept in original packaging and paced in a tote. so long as the parcel has applied pressure to the base there is no leak.

item.title: Report E-2024040394
item.description:
Report E-2024040394

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: HARLINGEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding (24) punctured or impacted 2.5-gallon jugs of Brimstone that resulted in approximately 2-gallons of product releasing onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete dock floor. The dock floor was impacted in a 2’x3’ area and the trailer floor was impacted in a 2’x8’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the released product and neutralized the impacted areas with soda ash. The damaged product, spill debris, and PPE were containerized for waste disposal in four 55-gallon poly drums. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

Content is a bucket of In the Swim Chlorinating Granules. Lid of bucket was loose and some spilled powder was seen in the box and in the tote. DescribePack: Loose caps appear to be the cause of damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was separated from other packages to prevent the spread of damage.

item.title: Report X-2024040589
item.description:
Report X-2024040589

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler had disregarded the Orientation arrows and placed the package on its side under the rollers. I was processing hazmat packages and noticed this. It was at this point that I placed the package in a damaged hazmat tote and took it to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Loose caps led to package leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was separated from other packages in an attempt to prevent the spread of damage.

The package was immediately inspected. we found that the plastic pail of calcium hypochlorite was cracked from top to bottom and the content was coming out of it. The package was removed from the delivery operation to be processed as damaged DescribePack: The plastic pail containing the calcium hypochlorite was cracked from top to bottom DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the delivery operation to be processed as damaged

DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four bottles was mostly empty. Box and other bottles were wet. One side of the box was completely ruined. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box and contents were placed into a salvage drum when moved to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040561
item.description:
Report X-2024040561

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in QA damage area. Closure at one end was open and box was inside of a Hazmat bag. Package was moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, no wet spots were seen on box but a strong smell was detected. A small amount of loose liquid was inside of the plastic bag containing the metal can. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a Hazmat bag when found. Leakage was not spreading. Package was placed into a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024040586
item.description:
Report X-2024040586

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a customer loaded trailer when it arrived to station. Package was on its side and leaking due to no bracing being used to secure hazmat packages, When discovered, pkg was bagged and placed in a red hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Leaked from cap due to being on its side. No seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A soaker pad was used to clean up any loose material that had spilled.

DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: was moved to hazmat cage and bay door was open.

item.title: Report X-2024040623
item.description:
Report X-2024040623

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA IN A LINED RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX HAS A 4" RIP ON ONE SIDE. TEAR IS SURROUNDED BY EVIDENCE OF CORROSIVE SUBSTANCE LEAK. DAMAGE IS PRIMARILY TO THE SIDE OF THE BOX IN MULTIPLE LOCATIONS. ORIENTATION ARROWS NOT FOLLOWED. INSIDE, 1 BOTTLE HAS A LOOSE CAP AND VENTED OPENING THAT HAS NO SEAL. DRIED SUBSTANCE ON ALL 4 BOTTLES. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: ALL CAPS TIGHTENED. OFFENDING BOTTLE WAS PUT INTO A GREEN HAZMAT BAG AND SEALED WITH A ZIP TIE. THE BOX AND ALL 4 BOTTLES PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND SEALED WITH A ZIP TIE.

item.title: Report E-2024040351
item.description:
Report E-2024040351

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing printing ink was punctured by the shipper's skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized cleaners and absorbents to further remediate the trailer. All ink-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal.

Some small drops of moisture and dry crust could be seen on the outside of the bottles. Test strip indicated a pH 12-14 when applied to the liquid drops.   • Description: SequenceEvent: package found at hazmat DescribePack: loose lids DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put in a lined hazmat tote and placed on containment pallet

There was no outer spill causing for no additional clean up. Hazmat was moved to cage 2 to be processed. DescribePack: Loose caps, no antileak bag, also no bracing to keep from moving inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in red tote.

DescribePack: the package had 3 of the 9 bottles with loose caps. And there were nine-quart bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put into a hazmat tub to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040333
item.description:
Report X-2024040333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver pulled up to point of delivery and went to pick up hazmat package. Driver discovered the hazmat package was leaking. Driver then brought the hazmat back to the station where it was picked up by QA to inspect. DescribePack: It was found that 1 bottle's closure cap had come off and was spilling onto the side of the package when moved around in drivers van. Loose caps and improper closure prevention. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver place package into a trash bag and set it to the back of his truck until returning to the station. Once returned package was placed into a hazardous materials tote by QA and taken to the stations hazmat cage.
